section.title: TRAFFIC_LINE_FACTORY
Description
section.para: This class is a factory for creating displayable representations of TRAFFIC_LINE objects. It inherits from EM_3D_OBJECT_FACTORY which provides the necessary structures such as the feature create_object or specify_object. specify_object contains the (OpenGL) commands to create the object and has to be implemented. To actually create and draw an object, the feature create_object of the factory is called, which returns a EM_3D_OBJECT. Then, the origin and scale of this object is set and the feature draw of the object is called.
section.title: Building a line
section.para: Each line segment is drawn independently, putting a circle at the beginning and the end to indicate that there are stations. Next, the 'polypoints' list is traversed and for each two points a rectangle of width line_width is created. These rectangles are connected with circles again, but smaller as the ones representing the stations.

section.title: BUILDING_FACTORY
Description
section.para: Similarly to TRAFFIC_LINE_FACTORY, this class is responsible for creating new buildings. You can add to BUILDING_FACTORY object new kinds of buildings and procedures that decide about the kind of building that should be created.
section.title: Types of buildings and decision process
section.para: Initially, TRAFFIC_LINE_FACTORY has no information about what kind of buildings there are and how to draw them. It has two containers, building_templates for drawing and gaugers for 'decision taking procedures'. Therefore, the object that wants to create buildings using an object of this class, can pass it his own drawing and 'decision taking procedures'. Then it may take_decision, giving it the name of the desired gauger and his parameters. Then this gauger decides by the means of his parameters which type of building to draw and stores his decision. That's how the factory knows what kind of building to draw if create_object is called later. This modus operandi garantees maximum flexibility.
